channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US orders Delta and Aeromexico to dissolve partnership that allowed them to price and schedule their flights jointly and share revenue
item.description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy says Mexico isn't being fair to U.S. airlines.

item.title: Fani Willis Loses Bid to Continue Prosecuting Georgia Trump Case
item.description: The 4-3 ruling means that the criminal case against President Trump, related to his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss, will not move forward ...

item.title: FDA warns Hims & Hers and other weight loss drugmakers to remove ‘false and misleading’ advertising
item.description: The agency on Tuesday posted more than 100 letters with 'cease and desist' language to various drugmakers and online prescribing companies.

item.title: Social media posts about Charlie Kirk’s death are baffling companies and exposing a bigger problem in American business
item.description: Advice from experts on how to navigate the nuances of political speech at work.

item.title: Our Allies Are Asking: ‘Why Does Putin Still Own Trump?’
item.description: Ukrainian and European officials, analysts and entrepreneurs keep asking privately, “What’s up with Trump?”

item.title: BofA sees gold hitting $4,000 per ounce in the second quarter of 2026. Here’s why the bank sees more room to run after recent record highs
item.description: You've heard that gold is hitting record highs. Not quite, Bank of America's Commodities team says.

item.title: State Terrorism Charges Against Luigi Mangione Are Dismissed

item.title: Suspect in Coinbase hack kept data for more than 10,000 customers on her phone, court filing alleges
item.description: The lawsuit also said that a Coinbase outsourcer fired human resources employees who were investigating the data breach.

item.title: Why the Kirk Assassination Is a Warning to the Left
item.description: Progressives need a cure for political desperation and despair.

item.title: Text Messages From Suspect in the Kirk Shooting Provide a Glimpse of a Motive

item.title: Europe’s Extreme Summer Weather Could Cost It Billions
item.description: Heat waves and flooding could cost the European Union $50 billion in damage to buildings and crops as well as a loss of productivity, a new study foun...

item.title: European Countries Condemn Israel’s Ground Offensive in Gaza City
item.description: Some of Israel’s oldest allies criticized its latest military assault in Gaza and warned of a deepening humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Palestinians Flee as Israeli Troops Push Into Gaza City

item.title: Israel’s Push Into Gaza City
item.description: We bring together pieces of Times journalism to help you understand the big picture.
